abstract.t: Delegated namespaces (domain names, IP address allocation, etc.) underpin almost every Internet entity but are centrally managed, unilaterally revokable, and lack a common interface. This draft specifies a generalized scheme for delegation with a structure that supports explicit delegation guarantees. The resulting data may be secured by any general purpose distributed consensus protocol; clients can query the local state of any number of participants and receive the correct result barring a compromise at the consensus layer.
